result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephon D Currie appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Stephon D Currie. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense moves to dismiss count 1 and count 4 
State gives argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss denied. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
